org.jlab.coda.emu.support.messaging

Class CMSGPortal

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.emu.support.messaging.CMSGPortal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoggerAppender

    public class CMSGPortal
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoggerAppender
    This class creates a connection to a cMsg server for the purposes of receiving run control commands and logging dalog messages.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Emu emu
      Store a reference to the EMU here (which is the only object that uses this CMSGPortal object).

    • Method Detail

      • cMsgServerConnect

        public void cMsgServerConnect()
                       throws EmuException
        Create 2 connections to the run control platform's cMsg domain server. Called during the configure transition since that is when the rc server sends us info about the platform host and cMsg domain server's TCP port.
        Throws:
        EmuException - if platform did not send its IP addresses and cMsg TCP port; if cannot connect to cMsg domain server in platform.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws org.jlab.coda.cMsg.cMsgException
        Disconnect from the runcontrol platform. Called from the EMU when quitting.
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.cMsg.cMsgException - never thrown

      • getPlatformHost

        public java.lang.String getPlatformHost()
        Get the IP address the platform is running on. Valid only after first config transition.
        Returns:
        IP address the platform is running on.

      • getPlatformPort

        public int getPlatformPort()
        Get the TCP port the platform's cMsg domain server is listening on. Valid only after first config transition.
        Returns:
        TCP port the platform's cMsg domain server is listening on.

      • getRcServer

        public org.jlab.coda.cMsg.cMsg getRcServer()
        Get the connection object to the rc multicast server of runcontrol platform.
        Returns:
        connection object to the rc multicast server of runcontrol platform.

        public org.jlab.coda.cMsg.cMsg getCmsgServer()

      • getRcUDL

        public java.lang.String getRcUDL()

        Returns:
        UDL used to make the connection to the rc server.

      • sendMHandlerMessage

        public void sendMHandlerMessage(int val,
                                java.lang.String type)
        Send messages to a callback in this emu so that it can send all rocs the lowest number of evio events received by this event builder in a single ET buffer. Using cMsg name server in platform.
        Parameters:
        val - lowest # of evio events found in a single ET buffer or reset (depending on type value)
        type - "M" if val is lowest # of evio events in a single ET buffer as reported by ET input channel or "reset" if clearing M values at prestart

      • sendRocMessage

        public void sendRocMessage(int lowM,
                           int highM,
                           int highSafeM)
        Send a message to the connected rocs specifying the lowest and highest number of evio events per single ET buffer that was received by the input channels to this emu. It also includes the value of the highest safe number of evio events for each ROC to place in an ET buffer. Using cMsg domain server in platform.
        Parameters:
        lowM - lowest number of ROC records per single ET buffer received by the input channels to this emu
        highM - highest number of ROC records per single ET buffer received by the input channels to this emu
        highSafeM - highest number of ROC records per single ET buffer that each ROC should be sending

      • append

        public void append(LoggingEvent event)
        Send a dalogmsg message using the cMsg system.
        Specified by:
        append in interface LoggerAppender
        Parameters:
        event - event to be logged

      • rcGuiInfoMessage

        public void rcGuiInfoMessage(java.lang.String text)
        Send an informational message that ends up on the run control gui.
        Parameters:
        text - text of message

      • rcGuiWarningMessage

        public void rcGuiWarningMessage(java.lang.String text)
        Send a warning message that ends up on the run control gui. Is the lightest of errors. Component's state does not change. Shows in orange.
        Parameters:
        text - text of message

      • rcGuiErrorMessage

        public void rcGuiErrorMessage(java.lang.String text)
        Send an error message that ends up on the run control gui. Is a medium error. Component must be reset. Shows in red.
        Parameters:
        text - text of message

      • rcGuiSevereMessage

        public void rcGuiSevereMessage(java.lang.String text)
        Send an error message that ends up on the run control gui. Worst error. Component must be killed and restarted in order to function. Shows in purple.
        Parameters:
        text - text of message
